It does have test coverage and is significantly documented. It only covers a few Qt modules.qts is a Qt5/6 and PyQt/PySide compatibility layer for your libraries and applications.It is designed to work with mypy and includes a CLI utility to notify mypy of the needed conditions.To keep the scope reasonable, qts will focus on the variances that all code using Qt will need such as imports and signals.Nuanced detailed differences will not be abstracted away.Helper functions and similar may be provided on a case by case basis... code-block:: python import qts import qts.util def main(): qts.set_wrapper(qts.available_wrappers()[0]) from qts import QtWidgets application = QtWidgets.QApplication([]) widget = QtWidgets.QLabel("this is qts") widget.show() qts.util.exec(application) main().. _documentation: https://qts.readthedocs.io..
